title: Educating national security leaders on artificial intelligence
summary: The "Artificial Intelligence for National Security Leaders" (AI4NSL) program at MIT aims to educate military and government leaders on the basics of AI, machine learning, and data science as they relate to national security. The program, organized by MIT's School of Engineering, MIT Stephen A. Schwarzman College of Computing, and MIT Sloan Executive Education, provides leaders with an understanding of AI technology and how to adopt it within their organizations. The course covers a range of topics, including AI concepts, organizational planning, and implementation. The program emphasizes collaboration and networking among participants and faculty from different schools at MIT. The curriculum is regularly updated to address the rapidly changing landscape of AI and national security.
